result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark D Mears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including but not limited to firearms.
The defendant is to comply with any conditions of 2014ME49.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark D Mears

defendant.name: Mears, Mark D
defendant.address: W1573 Aspen Ave, Pine River, WI 54965

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8:59 am case called. Defendant Mark D Mears in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses the dangerous weapon enhancer. No statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 90 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. CONDITIONS: Comply with 14ME49, AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of agent. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including but not limited to firearms. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on February 26, 2015 at 01:35 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to be in possession of any dangerous weapons, including any firearms.  Any device that may be used to harm his person or someone else.

Case Called @ 2:19 PM: Defendant Mark D Mears in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel.  NGP received and entered.   ADA argues for Signature Bond.  No statement as to bond request by Def.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:35 pm.
